Nerangs.ab: pas hum pyāle va hum urvarān barad va ān yek sokure-ye ḫāli nahand ān kasi ke ātaš miforuzad yek šāḫ-e esm va buy nahand va varsdān piš āwarad sar-aš begirad vars rā andar hum pyāle andāzad ān kasi ke hum pyāle be-dast dārad va hāvan daste u čab dast-e māhruy ǧā-i ke hum urwarān nahāde ast naheš pas angušt-e čab-e ḫod moḥkam var ruy-e ān vars va ḫalqe nahad čenānke vars rā binad pas xšnaoθra ahurahe mazdā̊ ašəm vōhū se frauuarāne gāh ānče bid zaraθuštrahe spitamahe aṣ̌aonō frauuaṣ̌əē xšnaoθra y. v. x. f. yaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā tā mraotū

"Then, he brings the hum-pyāle, the hum and the urvarān and puts an empty cup. The one who kindles the fire, puts a piece of esm and buy, brings the varasdān nearby, removes its lid and puts the vars in the hum-pyāle. The one who has the hum-pyāle has to place the hāvan and the pestle on the left side of māhruy where he has put the hum and the urvarān. Therefore, he should put firmly his left (hand's) finger on the vars and the ring so that he sees the vars. Then (he should recite) xšnaoϑra ahurahe mazdā̊ and three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and frauuarāne with the corresponding gāh (and the šnūman) zaraϑuštarahe spitāmahe aṣ̌aonō frauuaṣ̌ə̄ xšnaoϑra ẏ. v. x. f. and ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō zaotā until mraotū."

nirang farāhum gereftan fe nām-e dādār-e urmazd ke farāhum girid esm va buy yek tāk az kuste-ye rāst be nahešn va hum va urvarām fe čandaš be peydāyinešn va hum fe kuste se gereh va fe yašte post va yek gereh va urvarām andar hami nihešn tā avāǧ u be-har hum āyad fe pādyāv ke az āne zur avā šuyad šāyad ke yek dudigar fe in kār ul šuyad šāyad aṣ̌əm vohī se goftan frauuarāne zaraθuštrahe spitamahe aṣ̌aonō frauuaṣ̌əē xšnaoθra yasnāi. v. x. f. yaϑā ahī vairiiō zaotā tā ǧā-ye gofan

"Instructions for taking te farāhum. In the name of the creator Urmazd. The one takes the farāhim, he has to put a piece of esm and bu to the right and show the hum and urvarām. He should put in the same (saucer) three pieces (of hum) and and piece urvarām so that he can access again any (piece of) hum and can wash again with the with the pādyāv from the zur so that he can wash them again to this purpose. He should recite three Aṣ̌əm Vohūs and the frauuarāne (with the šnūman) zaraθuštrahe spitamahe aṣ̌aonō frauuaṣ̌əē xšnaoθra yasnāi v. x. f."
